segments.text: I see the water just pouring out of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is soaked, but she’s just polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely missing it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall, and the girl is just waiting for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole kitchen is going to be ruined by the time she notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but in here, it’s chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just ridiculous—someone needs to do something.
segments.speaker: PAR
